pr_title: Removed broken XML content/accept types from REST API

timeline.message: removed all XML content types and accepts from REST API
organized imports and formatted file for root controller
added xml content-type responses removal to changelog
reworded changelog entry for rest api xml removal
removed xml from rest api docs

timeline.author: deepsidhu85
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -20,7 +20,7 @@ The IRIDA REST API follows a standard output format, regardless of the resource
   1. As an individual resource,
   2. As part of a resource collection.
 
-Both XML and JSON are valid output formats for all resources. Some resources (notably resources representing files produced by a sequencer stored on the file-system) support output in FASTA or FASTQ format.
+Communication with the IRIDA REST API should be via the JSON format for sending and reciving data.  Generally this means using an `Accept` and `Content-type` of `application/json` for requests and submissions.  Some resources (for example sequence file and analysis result resources stored on the file-system) support output in FASTA or FASTQ format.
